Class Turtle

java.lang.Object
  Turtle

public class Turtle
extends Object

NOTE: Simplified documentation to help novices to use the Turtle class. For example, we ignore some details about object-oriented Java that are not necessary for students to write code using the Turtle class.

Turtle has more methods than are documented here. The full documentation is available (or will be soon)

Class that represents a Logo-style turtle. The turtle starts off facing north. A turtle can have a name, has a starting x and y position, has a heading, has a width, has a height, has a visible flag, has a body color, can have a shell color, and has a pen. The turtle will not go beyond the World boundaries.

Create the Turtle in a World.

Copyright Georgia Institute of Technology 2004

edits by Jaime Spacco 2025

Author:
Barb Ericson ericson@cc.gatech.edu

Constructor Summary
Turtle(int x, int y, World world)
          Constructor that takes the x and y position and the picture to draw on
Turtle(World world)
          Constructor that takes the World to draw on and will appear in the middle.

Remember, to create a World with generic default dimensions: 

    World w = new World();
    Turtle t = new Turtle(w); // creates a turtle in the middle of the world

And, to create a World with specific dimensions, you can do: 

    World w = new World(400, 400); // creates a 400x400 world
    Turtle t = new Turtle(w); // creates a turtle in the middle of the world
 
Method Summary
 void backward()
          Method to go backward by 100 pixels
 void backward(int pixels)
          Method to go backward a given number of pixels
 void clearPath()
          Method to clear the path (history of where the turtle has been)
 void forward()
          Method to move the turtle foward 100 pixels
 void forward(int pixels)
          Method to move the turtle forward the given number of pixels
 Color getBodyColor()
          Method to get the body color
 double getDistance(int x, int y)
          Get the distance from the passed x and y location
 double getHeading()
          Method to get the current heading.
The heading is the direction the turtle is facing, between 0 and 359 degrees.
 int getHeight()
          Method to return the height of this Turtle (in case you made the Turtle itself bigger or smaller)
 Color getInfoColor()
          Method to get the information color
 String getName()
          Method to get the name of the turtle
 Color getPenColor()
          Method to get the pen color
 int getPenWidth()
          Method to get the pen width
 int getWidth()
          Method to return the width of this turtle (in case you made the Turtle itself bigger or smaller)
 int getXPos()
          Method to get the current x position of the turtle
 int getYPos()
          Method to get the current y position (remember that 0, 0 is in the top-left, and the y values increase as you move down
 void hide()
          Method to hide the turtle (stop showing it) This doesn't affect the pen status
 boolean isPenDown()
          Method to check if the pen is down
 boolean isVisible()
          Method to get the value of the visible flag; this method tells us if the Turtle is visible
 void moveTo(int x, int y)
          Method to move to turtle to the given x and y location; if the pen is down, the Turtle will still draw while being movevd.
 void penDown()
          Method to set the pen down. When the pen is down the Turtle will draw when it moves.
 void penUp()
          Method to lift the pen up. When the pen is up, the Turtle can be moved around without drawing.
 void setBodyColor(Color color)
          Method to set the body color which will also set the pen color. So this changes the color of the turtle, and the color of the pen the turtle draws with.
 void setColor(Color color)
          Method to set the color of the turtle. Does not change the pen color.
 void setHeading(double heading)
          Method to set the heading, between 0 and 359.9 degrees. If you pick values out of range they will be converted; for example 380 degrees is 20 degrees, and -90 degrees is 270 degrees.
 void setHeight(int theHeight)
          Method to set the height of this turtle. Does not affect the width of the pen the Turtle draws with; this purely changes the appearance of the Turtle.
 void setName(String theName)
          Method to set the name of the turtle
 void setPenColor(Color color)
          Method to set the pen color
 void setPenDown(boolean value)
          Method to set the pen down boolean variable
 void setPenWidth(int width)
          Method to set the pen width. This is how many pixels wide the Turtle will draw. If you want thicker lines, this is your method!
 void setVisible(boolean value)
          Method to set the visible flag
 void setWidth(int theWidth)
          Method to set the width of this object
 void show()
          Method to show the turtle (doesn't affect the pen status
 String toString()
          Method to return a string with informaiton about this turtle
 void turn(double degrees)
          Method to turn the turtle the passed degrees use negative to turn left and pos to turn right
 void turnLeft()
          Method to turn left 90 degrees. Equivalent to calling turn(-90)
 void turnRight()
          Method to turn right by 90 degrees. Equivalent to calling turn(90)
 void turnToFace(int x, int y)
          Method to turn towards the given x and y. I guess this is useful.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
